name: Convert between decimals and fractions with denominators of 10 and 100

skills.name: Convert between decimals and fractions with denominators of 10 and 100

explanations.A: You have swapped round your numerator and denominator, the denominator is the bottom value...
explanations.B: You have correctly placed the 10 as the denominator but the numerator would not be 0.3. Think about your place value columns, how many tenths are there in 0.3?
explanations.C: The denominator is the bottom value in a fraction and 0.3 means we have 3 tenths so we write 3/10
explanations.D: The denominator is the value at the bottom of the fraction... Then you need to think about how many tenths there are in 0.3 (there is less than 30!)...

explanations.A: The denominator is the bottom value in a fraction and 0.6 means we have 6 tenths so we write 6/10
explanations.B: The denominator is the value at the bottom of the fraction... Then you need to think about how many tenths there are in 0.6 (there is less than 60!)...
explanations.C: You have correctly placed the 10 as the denominator but the numerator would not be 0.6. Think about your place value columns, how many tenths are there in 0.6?
explanations.D: You have swapped round your numerator and denominator, the denominator is the bottom value...

explanations.B: The denominator is the bottom value in a fraction and 0.8 means we have 8 tenths so we write 8/10
explanations.C: You have correctly placed the 10 as the denominator but the numerator would not be 0.8. Think about your place value columns, how many tenths are there in 0.8?
explanations.D: This is equivalent to 0.8 but the question asks for a fraction with a denominator of 10 not 5...

explanations.A: This is equivalent to 0.2 but the question asks for a fraction with a denominator of 10 not 5...
explanations.B: You have correctly placed the 10 as the denominator but the numerator would not be 0.2. Think about your place value columns, how many tenths are there in 0.2?
explanations.C: The denominator is the bottom value in a fraction and 0.2 means we have 2 tenths so we write 2/10

explanations.A: You have correctly placed the 100 as the denominator but the numerator would not be 0.78. Think about your place value columns, how many hundredths are there in 0.78?
explanations.B: This is equivalent to 0.78 but the question asks for a fraction with a denominator of 100 not 50...
explanations.C: You have swapped round your numerator and denominator, the denominator is the bottom value...
explanations.D: The denominator is the bottom value in a fraction and 0.78 means we have 7 tenths and 8 hundredths which is equivalent to 78 hundredths so we write 0.78 as 78/100

explanations.A: You have swapped round your numerator and denominator, the denominator is the bottom value...
explanations.B: The denominator is the bottom value in a fraction and 0.64 means we have 6 tenths and 4 hundredths which is equivalent to 64 hundredths so we write 0.64 as 64/100
explanations.C: You have correctly placed the 100 as the denominator but the numerator would not be 0.64. Think about your place value columns, how many hundredths are there in 0.64?
explanations.D: This is equivalent to 0.64 but the question asks for a fraction with a denominator of 100 not 50...

explanations.A: This is equivalent to 0.25 but the question asks for a fraction with a denominator of 100 not 4...
explanations.B: You have swapped round your numerator and denominator, the denominator is the bottom value...
explanations.C: The denominator is the bottom value in a fraction and 0.25 means we have 2 tenths and 5 hundredths which is equivalent to 25 hundredths so we write 0.25 as 25/100
explanations.D: You have correctly placed the 100 as the denominator but the numerator would not be 0.25. Think about your place value columns, how many hundredths are there in 0.25?

explanations.A: You have swapped round your numerator and denominator, the denominator is the bottom value...
explanations.B: You have correctly placed the 100 as the denominator but the numerator would not be 0.75. Think about your place value columns, how many hundredths are there in 0.75?
explanations.C: This is equivalent to 0.75 but the question asks for a fraction with a denominator of 100 not 4...
explanations.D: The denominator is the bottom value in a fraction and 0.75 means we have 7 tenths and 5 hundredths which is equivalent to 75 hundredths so we write 0.75 as 75/100

explanations.A: To find the equivalent decimal you need to do 45 ÷ 100...
explanations.C: You have done 45 ÷ 10, you need to do 45 ÷ 100...
explanations.D: You have done 45 ÷ 1000, you need to do 45 ÷ 100...

explanations.B: You have done 57 ÷ 1000, you need to do 57 ÷ 100...
explanations.C: To find the equivalent decimal you need to do 57 ÷ 100...
explanations.D: You have done 57 ÷ 10, you need to do 57 ÷ 100...
